metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5097 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
phpMyAdmin before 4.6.2 places tokens in query strings and does not arrange for them to be stripped before external navigation, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information by reading (1) HTTP requests or (2) server logs.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5097` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.6.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.6.2-1').
